messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] MICE
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know how well it would ork in a regular house, but people on a homesteading list I am on say they use those 5 gallon buckets with a little bit of grain
messages.messageBody:
I don't know how well it would ork in a regular house, but people on a homesteading list I am on say they use those 5 gallon buckets with a little bit of grain in the bottom for mice. The mice jump off of furniture etc to get in (they can jump really far), but they can't jump straight up to get out.

Jennifer

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] MICE
messages.msgSnippet: You ll want to use a disinfectant like Lysol because they carry more than their share of germs.  Also, Resolve is really got if they leave little yellow/brown
messages.messageBody:
You'll want to use a disinfectant like Lysol because they carry more than
their share of germs. Also, Resolve is really got if they leave little
yellow/brown marks on the carpet.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <Unschoolingmommy@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, April 06, 2002 1:10 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] MICE

messages.subject: MICE
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the help.  I also wanted to ask what you use to clean after the mice have made droppings, especially on carpet.  Sorry for such a yucky topic! Mary
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the help. I also wanted to ask what you use to clean after the
mice have made droppings, especially on carpet. Sorry for such a yucky topic!

Mary
